source_attribution.search_query: (BTC OR ETH OR SOL OR bitcoin OR ethereum OR solana OR altcoin) layer2 breakout trading

Bitcoin is retesting the golden cross, a technical formation that has historically preceded massive rallies, but as traders await...

hypothesis_content.title: L2 Breakout Failure: False Breakout Mean Reversion
hypothesis_content.statement: When an approved L2 token breaks above a key 30-day resistance level on low volume (<0.8x 20-day average) during a NEUTRAL/BEAR regime, and then fails to close >2% above that level, it will reverse and retrace to at least the 10-day VWAP within 48 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: In non-bull regimes, low-volume breakouts are often traps set by market makers or exhausted moves. The lack of follow-through confirms weakness. Mean reversion to VWAP is a common technical target. This is a counter-trend hypothesis for regime diversification.
entry_conditions: Asset in approved list (AVAX, ARB, SOL, etc.)
First 4-hour close after breakout is <2% above resistance
BTC daily performance neutral to negative (-1% to 0%)

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price sustains >3% above breakout level for 2 consecutive 4-hour closes

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Price continues climbing on increasing volume after the suspected false breakout, invalidating the low-volume trap thesis.
